Pre-Game Insights: Brazil are fifth in the standings on 10 points, ahead of Venezuela on goal difference in sixth.
Only the top six are guaranteed a berth at the 2026 finals.
Brazil lost four of their last five qualifiers and are grappling with mounting pressure and uncertainty.
Manager Dorival Jr has won only two competitive games since taking charge in January.
Brazil lost 1-0 to Paraguay in their last qualifier, who had only scored once in their previous seven qualifiers.
Five changes were made to Brazil's initial squad due to injuries, including goalkeeper Alisson, defenders Bremer, Eder Militao, Guilherme Arana, and forward Vinicius Jr.
Igor Jesus was named to start up-front against Chile, leaving Real Madrid's Endrick on the bench.
